ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Domtar Paper Company, LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_narrative_name: Domtar Paper Company, LLC FERC Electric Tariff, Original Volume No. 1
record_data.record_plain_text: Domtar Paper Company, LLC FERC ELECTRIC TARIFF, ORIGINAL VOLUME NO. 1 1. Availability: Domtar Paper Company, LLC (Seller) makes electric energy and capacity available for resale under this FERC Electric Tariff Original Volume No. 1 (Rate Schedule) to any purchaser for resale with whom Seller has contracted (Purchaser), except as prohibited. 2. Applicability: This Rate Schedule is applicable to all sales of energy or capacity by Seller not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule of Seller. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the Purchaser and Seller that are subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ("Commission") and are not made pursuant to a particular rate schedule on file with the Commission. 4. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Sellers market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this Rate Schedule or otherwise restricts or limits Sellers market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Sellers market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Rate Schedule. 5. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Seller does not have any limitations on its market-based rate authority, except as may otherwise be provided in this Rate Schedule. Seller has obtained waivers of: Subpart B and C of Part 35 regarding the filing of tariffs, with the exception of sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; Part 41, regarding accounts; Part 101, regarding the uniform system of accounts, records and memoranda; and Part 141, regarding statements and reports with the exceptions of sections 141.14 and 141.15. Seller also has blanket approval under Part 34 of the Commissions regulations of future issuances of securities and assumptions of liabilities. See Docket No. ER11-2020. 6. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between Purchaser and Seller. 7. Seller Category: Seller is a Category 1 Seller as defined in 18 C.F.R. §35.36(a). 8. Effective Date: This Rate Schedule is effective as of the date specified by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
record_data.filing_title: Amendment to Domtar Paper MBR Filing
